elements.title: Mike Sadler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mike Sadler (pictured) guided nighttime raids on enemy targets as a celestial navigator during the Western Desert campaign?

elements.title: a California TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the founder of a California TV station opted not to name it for himself because the call sign would have sounded like "cough"?

elements.title: William N. Salin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William N. Salin was twice decorated with the Sagamore of the Wabash?

elements.title: Tamara Milashkina (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Soviet soprano Tamara Milashkina performed alongside her husband Vladimir Atlantov at New York's Metropolitan Opera in 1975?

elements.title: Englewood Golf Club (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that for a while in the 1950s, Englewood Golf Club was co-owned by four well-known comedians?

elements.title: Prey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Prey is the only feature film to have a full Comanche language dub?

elements.title: Margaret Donahue (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Margaret Donahue was the first female executive in Major League Baseball?

elements.title: corpses in their houses (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that for several millennia, some humans buried corpses in their houses?
